cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 305 mi W of Key West Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to turn northwest then north-northeast, cross Florida’s Big Bend and move northeastward just offshore of the GA/SC/NC coasts before heading into the open Atlantic

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central and northern Florida Gulf Coast, then Georgia through North Carolina Atlantic coasts
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (<10%) of tropical-storm-force gusts late Friday night into Saturday; breezy conditions expected
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor tidal run-up (<2 ft) possible along the lower Chesapeake Bay and oceanfront
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands could drop 1–3 inches of rain on Saturday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and elevated wave heights may disrupt vessel schedules and cargo handling
